bibl.title: Greek, Egyptian and Roman Law.
bibl.note: Revised version of a paper presented on 17 July 1998 to a conference, held at the British Academy in London, to mark the centenary of the first volume of The Oxyrhynchus Papyri. - Examines how the encounter of different civilizations and legal traditions between Alexander's conquest and the Arab conquest of Egypt affects the legal concepts and their application in everyday life.
bibl.seg: MAEHLER Herwig, Greek, Egyptian and Roman Law.

Revised version of a paper presented on 17 July 1998 to a conference, held at the British Academy in London, to mark the centenary of the first volume of The Oxyrhynchus Papyri. - Examines how the encounter of different civilizations and legal traditions between Alexander's conquest and the Arab conquest of Egypt affects the legal concepts and their application in everyday life.
